item.title: Desire and Its Nature – Pt. 2
item.description:
"Man is broad, too broad. I'd have him narrower."
— Fyodor Dostoevsky

There’s a tendency I’ve noticed in myself — when one desire fades, another appears. It’s automatic. Quiet, but constant. It doesn’t wait for satisfaction; it replaces the previous urge before I’ve even realized I’m done with it.

I’ve started to wonder if this is just how the soul operates — not in greed, but in misunderstanding. Always reaching because it doesn’t know what would make it still.
